Innocence Theory - Searching for a Note


About the E.P 'Searching for a Note'

EP consists of 5 tracks

Another World - Vocal chilled out, ambient, Trip hop

Om Ma Ni Padme hum - Tibetan chant, Hypnotic meditation, ambient, drone

Today is the day - vocals, happy, alternative

Blue Waters - New age, instrumental, ambient, orchestral

Blissfully Trapped in solitude - Dark, heavy, Bass, delayed, drone

 What is Innocence Theory?
 
 Innocence Theory is an anonymous collective from Pune, India with a 2 member principal lineup and collaborations with other indie artists. They have launched their debut E.P 'Searching for a Note'. Innocence Theory started out as lets-see-where-this-goes studio sessions between 2 musicians. The  E.P 'Searching for a Note' is an attempt to reflect on the musical philosophies of the members and bring out honest music. The E.P consists of 5 tracks with genres ranging from Ambient, Vocals , Meditative, New Age to Hypnotic and chilled out music. 
 
 
 Searching for a Note
 
 Innocence Theory's debut EP 'Searching for a Note' released in March 2015 , is a concept album that reflects change, dynamism and a journey. While music appeals differently to different people, 'Searching for a Note' brings together constrasting musical philosophies and sounds, and has an underlying story to each of the tracks. Each track has been done in collaboration with other artists.
